descript.abstract: U.S. Highways represents the major and minor highways of the United States. These include interstates, U.S. highways, state highways, major roads, and minor roads. This dataset is from the Census 2000 TIGER/Line files. It contains all Class 1, 2, and 3 road segments plus any other road segments necessary to provide network connectivity for the Class_Rte field.
descript.purpose: U.S. Highways provides highways and roads for national, state, and regional display.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the 2000 Census TIGER/Line files. The positional accuracy varies with the source materials used, but generally the information is no better than the established national map Accuracy standards for 1:100,000-scale maps from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). To improve the accuracy, TomTom ran a process against the entire nationwide database. The level of positional accuracy in the StreetMap™ files is not suitable for high-precision measurement applications such as engineering problems, property transfers, or other uses that might require highly accurate measurements of the earth's surface.

citeinfo.title: TomTom TIGER/Line 2000 Streets
citeinfo.othercit: TIGER/Line 2000 Data Processed by a proprietary line straightening process by TomTom North America, Inc.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: From StreetMap Detailed Streets, extracted all Class 1, 2, and 3 road segments plus any other road segments necessary to provide network connectivity for the CLASS_RTE attribute. Converted the data set to SDC. Created the projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by Esri: Corrected a few known errors. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
Converted the dataset into a file geodatabase.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the major and minor highways of the United States. These include Interstates, U.S. Highways, State Highways, major roads, and minor roads.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Prefix directions of the address attributes for the features.
Prefix highway types of the address attributes for the features.
Suffix highway types of the address attributes for the features.
Suffix directions of the address attributes for the features.

attr.attrdef: The highway class (used for routing and connectivity).

edom.edomvd: A special class of highway to do very fast high level cross-country routing that also selects the through-route in complicated urban areas.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
